canonical.name: Tchia Jen
canonical.title: 37. Tchia Jen / The Family
canonical.judgment: For the realisation of what is taught in Tchia Jen, or for the regulation of the family, what is most advantageous is that the wife be firm and correct.
canonical.image: The trigram representing fire, and that for wind coming forth from it, form Tchia Jen. The superior person, in accordance with this, orders their word according to the truth of things, and their conduct so that it is uniformly consistent.

1.text: shows its subject establishing restrictive regulations in their household. Occasion for repentance will disappear.

2.text: shows its subject taking nothing on herself, but in her central place attending to the preparation of the food. Through her firm correctness there will be good fortune.

3.text: shows its subject treating the members of the household with sternness, there will be peril, but there will also be good fortune. If the wife and children were to besmirking and chattering, in the end there would be occasion for regret.

4.text: shows its subject enriching the family. There will be great good fortune.

5.text: shows the influence of the king extending to their family. There need be no anxiety; there will be good fortune.

6.text: shows its subject possessed of sincerity and arrayed in majesty. In the end there will be good fortune.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
